snippet: Plaintiffs who were put under quarantine in 2014 planned to file a class-action lawsuit alleging the state violated their rights with unnecessary detentions.
abstract: Yale law students will file class-action lawsuit against Connecticut Gov Dannel P Malloy and state's acting and former health officials over state's Ebola quarantine policies, which compelled some residents, including two Yale graduate students, to stay inside their homes for up to three weeks.
